text: yes that ruling from the Court of Appeal
just a short time ago that ched Evans
appeal has been successful his appeal
against his conviction that conviction
has been quashed and there will now be a
retrial
Chen Evans was jailed in 2012 and he was
released from prison in 2014 after
serving half of a five-year term an
appeal hearing took place last month
over two days in front of three Appeal
Court judges and today Lady Justice
Hallet handed down the judgment of that
court she went through some of the
background briefly she said that the
appeal had come to the court by
reference from the criminal cases Review
Commission on the basis that relevant
and admissible evidence had come to
light that was not available at trial
and that undermined the safety of his
conviction she said in summary the
judges had concluded that they must
allow the appeal and that it was in the
interests of justice to order a retrial
but there are also restrictions on what
can be reported because there there is
to be a retrial so in summary the appeal
has been allowed the conviction has been
quashed and there there will be a
retrial we were told that the venue of
that retrial where it will take place
who will be the judge the date of that
retrial have yet to be set
